channel.title: Arcanian's Greatsword [2nd model ever!]
channel.description:
Hi I would like you to rate my 2nd ever made model... So here are the pics:
[img]http://img28.imageshack.us/img28/5375/guardian1.png[/img] [img]http://img406.imageshack.us/img406/8109/guardian2.png[/img] [img]http://img691.imageshack.us/img691/4948/guardian3.png[/img]
Ou, by the way, It's better that you have less polygons, right? Heh, why did I smooth it and save just after that... Well anyway, rate it... :(

item.title: Arcanian's Greatsword [2nd model ever!]
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

Wut?

Anyways, lamborghini ftw. Although tracing may seem one of the best methods for modeling, it may as well be only efficient for RS models only. Most models out there have much more depth, meaning that tracing will prove ineffective. So you may want to learn primitive modeling. I usually use prims, but I also often make models from scratch. Typically my scratch models do look nice, but my prims seem much more neatly done. If you dig around this forum, you should find my Bitter Oblivion (scratch), Scythe (primitive), and TWW Mirror Shield (traced). I’m sure you’ll say the mirror shield is the best out of the three, but also notice how thin it is. Any thin model can be better done with tracing or even from scratch, but primitives have endless possibilities, even with thin models, so I’d suggest practicing with them.

Read full topic

item.title: Arcanian's Greatsword [2nd model ever!]
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

[quote=“The Arcanian, post:63, topic:316288”]Well if this is real… Hat takes some sick skills…
But won’t tracing this model take less time?
Ofcourse it’s hard to make a ferray using just primitives, but still?[/quote]
Tracing becomes less efficient as the model becomes more complex, and the mesh structure becomes more and more hideous, which is why i always suggest primitive modelling. tracing is fine for anything RS related though, since the models are generally basic.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch2 wrote:

[quote=“The Arcanian, post:61, topic:316288”]Tracing and primitives…
I think that i am staying with tracing.

It’s almost imposible to make a primitive model as good as a “traced” one. Im not saying that im great at modeling, but just look at primiive model and a traced one. Wich one is going to look better and detailed in-game? Ofcourse the traced one… unless you spend like 14hours one the primitive model.

As i sayd, i am going just for the result. Not the process… ofcourse the procees is quite interesting and fun, but i care just about the in-game look…[/quote]Your REALY wrong right there. You’ve seen the newbys work.
This is a primitive model:

The gun i modeled is primitive too.

item.title: Arcanian's Greatsword [2nd model ever!]
item.dc:creator: @The_Arcanian The Arcanian
item.description:
@The_Arcanian wrote:

Tracing and primitives…
I think that i am staying with tracing.

It’s almost imposible to make a primitive model as good as a “traced” one. Im not saying that im great at modeling, but just look at primiive model and a traced one. Wich one is going to look better and detailed in-game? Ofcourse the traced one… unless you spend like 14hours one the primitive model.

As i sayd, i am going just for the result. Not the process… ofcourse the procees is quite interesting and fun, but i care just about the in-game look…

u guys are dumb… its a trace. it could be his 1st model ever and i could believe it was his. traces arent impressive anymore. anyone can trace. thats hardly modelling.

item.title: Arcanian's Greatsword [2nd model ever!]
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Primitive modelling is not shitty if you know how to do it.
I wouldn’t call segmenting a few cylinders and merging them with other cylinders primitive modelling, as most of the guys here would. It means literally using primitive shapes, and stretching out individual vertexes into a shape of any kind.
Trace modelling has its limits, for example, try trace modelling a car, or helmet, or platebody, it’s pretty darn hard.

Read full topic

All you gotta do is learn how to use and manipulate primitives. Once, you can, your models may be all primitives, and they’ll be amazing too.
